description: Comprehensive compliance guidelines for YouTube content in European markets, aligned with EU regulations and national broadcasting standards.

regional_notes.overview: Europe has harmonized standards through EU regulations while maintaining national variations. GDPR affects data handling, while AVMSD (Audiovisual Media Services Directive) governs content standards.
regional_notes.eu_wide: EU-wide standards prohibit hate speech, require age verification for certain content, and mandate content warnings. GDPR requires privacy compliance.
regional_notes.germany: Strict laws on Nazi symbols, Holocaust denial, violence in games/media (USK ratings), and hate speech (NetzDG law).
regional_notes.france: Strict advertising rules, protection of French language, limits on alcohol advertising (Loi Évin).
regional_notes.uk: Post-Brexit follows Ofcom guidelines. Strict watershed rules, advertising standards (ASA), and hate speech laws.
regional_notes.nordic: Generally liberal standards but strict on alcohol advertising and child protection.
regional_notes.southern_europe: Spain, Italy, Portugal - moderate standards with Catholic cultural influences.

Kids (G).description: Content suitable for all European audiences including young children
restricted: Very mild peril with positive resolution
general_requirements: Must comply with EU child protection standards
No advertising targeting children for unhealthy products
Positive messaging and educational value preferred

Teens (PG-13).description: Content for teenagers with parental guidance suggested

Adult (R).description: Mature content for adult audiences with regional restrictions
prohibited: Hate speech and discrimination based on protected characteristics
Nazi symbols in glorifying context (especially Germany/Austria)
general_requirements: Watershed rules for broadcast (after 9/10 PM typically)

violence.notes: European standards distinguish between fictional and real violence. Gratuitous violence is restricted. Germany has particularly strict rules on violent video game content.

profanity.notes: European standards are generally more permissive on profanity than US. However, slurs and discriminatory language are strictly prohibited.

alcohol.notes: Advertising is heavily regulated (Loi Évin in France, Nordic restrictions). Depiction in content is generally permitted for adults but must not target minors or promote binge drinking.

tobacco.notes: EU Tobacco Products Directive restricts tobacco advertising. Smoking depicted in content should not be glamorized. E-cigarette advertising restricted in many countries.

drugs.notes: Drug use cannot be promoted. Some countries have decriminalized cannabis but advertising remains prohibited. Educational/awareness content is permitted.

sexual_content.notes: Europe is generally more permissive than US on nudity and sexual content in artistic contexts. However, explicit pornography is age-restricted and child exploitation is strictly illegal.

hate_speech.notes: Strictly prohibited under EU law and national laws. Includes discrimination based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability. Germany's NetzDG requires rapid removal.

nazi_symbols.notes: Prohibited in Germany and Austria in glorifying contexts. Educational/historical use may be permitted but requires careful handling. Austrian law (Verbotsgesetz) is particularly strict.

gambling.notes: Regulated differently across EU. Online gambling advertising restricted in many countries. must comply with national licensing requirements.

misinformation.notes: EU Digital Services Act requires platforms to address disinformation. Health misinformation (especially COVID) is particularly scrutinized.

platform_specific_rules.gdpr_compliance: All content involving EU citizens' data must comply with GDPR. This includes user-generated content featuring identifiable individuals.
platform_specific_rules.right_to_be_forgotten: EU citizens have the right to request removal of content featuring them under certain circumstances
platform_specific_rules.dsa_compliance: Digital Services Act compliance required for content moderation and transparency
platform_specific_rules.copyright: Must comply with EU Copyright Directive - be aware of Articles 15 and 17 requirements
